newsitem.title: USA: Mitsubishi, 29 women plaintiffs agree on mediation.
newsitem.headline: Mitsubishi, 29 women plaintiffs agree on mediation.

text.p: Mitsubishi Motor Manufacturing of American and 29 women suing the company for sexual harassment have agreed to allow a mediator to resolve the five-year-old lawsuit, lawyers for both sides said on Tuesday.
"Counsel for the 29 women plaintiffs and the company expressed their hope that this process will lead to a fair and rapid resolution of the lawsuit," the two parties said in a statement.
As part of the agreement, both sides have agreed not to comment on mediation until the process is completed, the statement said.

The civil suit filed in 1992 in U.S. District Court in Peoria, Ill., predated the larger, well-publicised sexual harrassment suit filed April 9, 1996, by the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission covering around 700 female workers at the company's Normal, Ill., plant. Authorities said the government case may be the largest sexual harrassment case ever brought, with up to $300,000 in damages for each employee.
Both lawsuits made similar allegations: that the company tolerated groping, sexual graffiti and degrading remarks by male workers and supervisors against the plant's female workers.
Mitsubishi Motor Manufacturing of America is a unit of Mitsubishi Motors Corp..
